Program Director Talk:
In an era dominated by vast medical knowledge and rapid advancements, the ability to effectively communicate complex information is essential. Infographics, as visual
representations of data, play a crucial role in understanding medical conceptseasily. Through structured, engaging, and visually appealing designs, they transform information into accessible knowledge, fostering clarity and retention among medical students.
The significance of infographic representation lies in its ability to bridge the gap between
textual data and cognitive processing, ensuring ease of delivery. By integrating concise explanations with visual elements, infographics enhance understanding, facilitating quick absorption of essential medical information.
Moreover, the use of infographics into medical education allows students to grasp complex topics efficiently, reinforcing critical thinking and analytical skill.
As medical education evolves, the adoption of infographic-based methodologies continues to enhance teaching practices and this is what we train our students here at Faculty of Medicine, Mansoura National University to do. By presenting information in an
attractive and structured manner, infographics empower students to navigate the ever-growing medical landscape with confidence and efficiency. Their value is indispensable in shaping the future of medical professionals, equipping them with the
tools needed for effective communication and lifelong learning.
Prof: Amira Taman
Director of the program of medicine and surgery, Mansoura National University
